awd_titl_txt: A Proposal to Support the High School Honors Science Programat Michigan State University
awd_abstract_narration: Michigan State University will initiate a seven-week,                           multidisciplinary, residential High School Honors Science Program               (HSHSP) for 28 high-ability/high-potential students entering grades             11,12 across the nation.                                                                                                                                        During the seven-week period students will engage in independent                research in the laboratory of a Michigan State University faculty               member.  Additional activities will include seminars, discussions               and debates about issues of importance to their particular area of              research and to the broader scientific enterprise.  They will be                afforded opportunities to investigate careers in the sciences both              through organized discussions with professionals on campus and at               field trip sites.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
